myData.name: Gautam Singhal
myData.oneLiner: Designing scalable systems, high-reliability backends, and full-stack applications.
myData.description: I’m a backend-focused full-stack developer specializing in Java (Spring Boot) and React.js, with a strong interest in system design and scalable architectures. I build high-performance, fault-tolerant applications that operate reliably under real-world traffic. My experience includes real-time messaging systems, secure authentication microservices, e-commerce platforms, and AI-powered services, with an emphasis on clean architecture, efficient data flows, and strong security boundaries. I continuously strengthen my problem-solving skills through data structures and algorithms, and enjoy reasoning about system trade-offs to deliver production-ready solutions with long-term maintainability.

Redesigned trade processing workflows, reducing deployment cycles from 2 weeks to 4 days by removing cross-team bottlenecks.
Improved processing reliability and data accuracy, reducing operational delays by 30%.

project.title: Messenger Chats – Realtime Microservice-based Chat System

titleImage.name: Messenger Chats Banner
titleImage.description: Banner representing the realtime communication system

project.shortDesc: A realtime chat application built using Java Spring Boot microservices, WebSockets (STOMP), JWT authentication, and a React + Vite frontend.

overview: Messenger Chats is a realtime messaging platform where every user establishes a WebSocket session and subscribes to their personal message topic. This allows instant message delivery, presence awareness, and rapid UI updates.

Messenger Chats uses REST APIs as a fallback and as the primary source of truth — all chat data is fetched on login from these endpoints, and message history is loaded with server-side pagination on the chat screen to ensure consistency and reliable syncing.

The system supports message lifecycle stages — SENT, DELIVERED, and SEEN — driven by a hybrid mechanism combining WebSockets and fallback REST APIs. This ensures reliable state syncing even under unstable network conditions.

The backend follows a microservice pattern, using a login/auth microservice for identity, a dedicated Messenger microservice for message operations, and a STOMP WebSocket layer for broadcasting events.
keyFeatures: Realtime WebSocket-based chat
Message statuses: SENT, DELIVERED, SEEN
Fallback REST APIs for status reliability
Cursor-based pagination for chat history
User search with SQL LIKE
Browser notifications for new messages
Message edit/delete
Online/offline detection
Conversation previews with unread counts
Microservice architecture with JWT handshake validation
techStack: Backend: Java Spring Boot, PostgreSQL, JWT, WebSockets (STOMP), SimpMessagingTemplate, RestTemplate
Frontend: React + Vite, Axios, Browser Notifications API
Architecture: Microservice-oriented with dedicated login service
detail.engineeringHighlight: The most challenging part of the system is the synchronized status update pipeline. Messages move from SENT → DELIVERED → SEEN using both WebSocket push events and periodic batched updates from the frontend. Every 10 seconds, the client sends lists of delivered and seen messageIds through the WebSocket channel. The backend updates these states and broadcasts them to the message senders, ensuring that the UI always reflects the latest status even during network inconsistencies or missed events.

project.title: AI Bot Microservice – Plug-and-Play AI Chat Bot

titleImage.name: AI Bot Microservice Banner
titleImage.description: Banner representing the AI chat microservice

project.shortDesc: A backend-only microservice providing AI-powered chat functionality. It is stateless, plug-and-play, and integrates seamlessly with other applications like Messenger Chats.

overview: AI Bot Microservice is a stateless backend service designed to add AI chat capabilities to any application. It currently powers the AI agent in Messenger Chats project.
The microservice receives user messages along with the last six messages (if available) for context, calls the Hugging Face model `HuggingFaceTB/SmolLM3-3B:hf-inference`, and returns a response.
It appears as a virtual contact in integrated platforms, allowing users to chat with an AI agent just like a real user.
keyFeatures: Stateless AI chat microservice – no database required
Context-aware responses using last six messages
Plug-and-play integration with other applications
Uses Hugging Face model `HuggingFaceTB/SmolLM3-3B:hf-inference` for AI-powered responses
JWT authentication for secure API calls
Real-time message responses
Lightweight and scalable backend
techStack: Backend: Java Spring Boot, JWT, REST APIs
detail.engineeringHighlight: The core engineering challenge was to maintain contextual awareness in AI responses while keeping the service stateless. By sending the last six messages along with the current input to the Hugging Face model `HuggingFaceTB/SmolLM3-3B:hf-inference`, the system generates coherent and contextually relevant replies without storing any user data locally.

project.title: Wrap & Wow – E-commerce Gift Card Platform

titleImage.name: Wrap & Wow Banner
titleImage.description: Banner representing the gift card e-commerce platform

project.shortDesc: A full-stack e-commerce application for gift cards with admin analytics, personalized gifting, and real-time order updates. Built with Spring Boot microservices and a React + Vite frontend.

overview: Wrap & Wow is a full-stack e-commerce platform focused on gift cards. Users can browse, purchase, and send digital gift cards.

The backend is structured as a set of Spring Boot microservices, handling users, gift cards, orders, notifications, and analytics. Login and authentication are integrated via secure APIs through a Authentication MIcroservice.
The admin dashboard provides real-time insights into sales, revenue, and user activity, enabling efficient management of gift cards, orders, and promotions.
keyFeatures: User registration, login, and JWT authentication from Login Microservice
Browse gift cards with category, price, and occasion filters
Add to cart, checkout, and Order page
Order history and status tracking
Admin analytics dashboard for sales and popular gift cards
Gift card CRUD management for admins
Search gift cards, by top sellers and trending
Promotions, discounts, and special offers management
techStack: Backend: Java Spring Boot, PostgreSQL, JWT, RestTemplate
Frontend: React + Vite, Axios, Browser Notifications API
Architecture: Microservice-oriented with dedicated user, order, gift card, and analytics service and login microservice
detail.engineeringHighlight: The most complex aspect of Wrap & Wow is the integration of real-time order. Users receive instant updates on gift card delivery, while the admin dashboard reflects live sales and order activity. Analytics are reliable and scalable.

project.title: Login Microservice – Authentication & Authorization System

titleImage.name: Login Microservice Banner
titleImage.description: Banner representing the authentication microservice in a project.

project.shortDesc: A Spring Boot microservice for authentication and authorization, implementing JWT-based security with RSA algorithm, OTP-based signup with E-mail support, and secure user management.

overview: This microservice provides secure authentication and authorization for multiple applications, including user registration, login, password management, and JWT token handling.
It uses Spring Security with JWT (RSA-signed access and refresh tokens) for stateless authentication, along with E-mail based OTP verification for signup and password resets.
The service also includes global exception handling, rate-limiting for OTP requests, and utilities for logging and standardized API responses.
keyFeatures: User registration with OTP verification
Login with JWT-based access and refresh tokens
Logout and refresh token invalidation
Forgot password flow with OTP verification
Reset password flow for logged-in users
Resend OTP support with rate-limiting
Global exception handling and standardized error responses
Spring Security integration with CORS, CSRF, and custom access/denied handlers
RSA key-based JWT signing for enhanced security
Reusable microservice for authentication across multiple projects
techStack: Backend: Java Spring Boot, Spring Security, PostgreSQL, JWT (RSA), RestTemplate
Other: Global exception handling, OTP email integration, rate limiting
detail.engineeringHighlight: The core engineering challenge is implementing a secure and reusable authentication microservice with OTP verification, JWT token lifecycle management, and global exception handling. RSA key pairs are used for token signing, providing high security, while staging tables for signup and password reset ensure safe verification flows.

project.title: Portfolio – Full Stack Showcase

titleImage.name: Portfolio Banner
titleImage.description: Banner representing Gautam's full stack project's portfolio

project.shortDesc: A full-stack portfolio platform to showcase my projects, skills, and personal info. Built with Java Spring Boot backend and React + Vite frontend with MongoDB powering it with data.

overview: Portfolio is a full-stack web application for showcasing personal projects, skills, and professional information.
The backend is powered by Java Spring Boot and MongoDB, handling uploads of project JSON data, 'About Me' content upload thorugh JSON file, and contact us form submissions.
Frontend is built with React + Vite, rendering project details, images, tech stacks, and external links in a visually appealing manner.
keyFeatures: Superadmin-only access to upload 'About Me' and project details
JSON-based project upload system for bulk creation and edits
Display projects with images, tech stack, description, and links
Contact form for Viewers to send messages
Ping API to check backend status
Project listing, retrieval by ID, and deletion capabilities
techStack: Backend: Spring Boot, MongoDB, JWT for superadmin authentication
Frontend: React + Vite, Axios for API calls
Architecture: Full-stack Microservice backend with API endpoints consumed by React frontend
detail.engineeringHighlight: This platform provides a structured, backend-driven way to maintain portfolio content entirely via JSON uploads, keeping content management simple and consistent. It integrates MongoDB for flexible data storage and Cloudinary for image hosting, ensuring the frontend dynamically renders project content and media efficiently.
